alert.note: Alert for Collingsworth (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 5:40PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Collingsworth County through 615 PM CDT... At 539 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout 9 miles west of Dozier, or 19 miles southwest of Shamrock, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts and wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Collingsworth County. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
